h1.a: J&J: Spraying cologne, NBA tiers, something's up with the Saints, voicemails

div.p: This is the Jalen & Jacoby podcast-exclusive hour, coming to you every Tuesday and Thursday. The guys discuss Jalen’s style out of the gate, including what’s up with his hair, what he’s wearing on TV Christmas Day and his technique for spraying cologne. Then they talk about biggest challengers to the Lakers in the Western Conference, Jalen’s NBA tiers, Jacoby’s prediction Damian Lillard will win the MVP and Gordon Hayward’s hand surgery. Later, Dwayne Haskins hits the strip club after a loss, something’s up with the Saints, JuJu Smith-Schuster needs to stop dancing on midfield logos and the biggest threat to the Chiefs. Finally, they answer voicemails on hot tubs and going to the strip club when you’re broke.

h1.a: First Take hour 2: The NBA tips off tonight, who most needs to win a title this year?

div.p: Max, Domonique Foxworth and Kendrick Perkins debate who is the team you trust most in the AFC North, what happens next with Carson Wentz in Philly and who needs to win the NBA championship this season the most.

h1.a: Fantasy Focus Football: Previewing All Of Week The 16 Fantasy Championship Action

div.p: Field, Matthew, Stephania and Daniel recap Monday Night Football and talk who needs to be in your lineup for the fantasy championships.

h1.a: Waving Terrible Towels? Ravens need help to get into playoffs

div.p: The Ravens need help for a playoff berth, and they are relying on their arch enemies-- the Steelers -- to provide it.
Ravens have 7 players named to the Pro Bowl: CB Marlon Humphrey, DE Calais Campbell, K Justin Tucker, LB Matthew Judon, FB Patrick Ricard, OT Orlando Brown and LS Morgan Cox

h1.a: Fantasy Focus Football: Week 15 Review, Injury Updates

div.p: Field, Matthew, Stephania and Daniel recap Week 15 and talk which fantasy stars you can rely on for the rest of the season.

div.span: Has J.K. Dobbins taken over as Ravens' lead back? (0:33)

h1.a: Lamar Jackson and Ravens again hitting stride in December

div.p: The Ravens had no trouble dispatching the one-win Jaguars behind an efficient Jackson, who accounted for four touchdowns.

h1.a: Jackson leads surging Ravens to 40-14 rout of Jaguars

div.p: — The Baltimore Ravens built a 26-point halftime lead against helpless Jacksonville and rolled to a 40-7 victory Sunday that boosted their playoff chances and extended the Jaguars' losing streak to 13 games.

The Ravens rough up the outclassed Jaguars, 40-14. Lamar Jackson threw three touchdowns and ran for another. This marked the sixth time of Jackson's career that he has totaled four or more touchdowns in a game. The only bad news is the Colts and Dolphins both won. Right now, Ravens (9-5) remain No. 8 in seven-team AFC playoff race despite winning their third straight game. Baltimore now plays host to the New York Giants on Sunday.

ul.data-name: The Ravens rough up the outclassed Jaguars, 40-14. Lamar Jackson threw three touchdowns and ran for another. This marked the sixth time of Jackson's career that he has totaled four or more touchdowns in a game. The only bad news is the Colts and Dolphins both won. Right now, Ravens (9-5) remain No. 8 in seven-team AFC playoff race despite winning their third straight game. Baltimore now plays host to the New York Giants on Sunday.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

h1.a: Dez throws X after first TD catch in over 3 years

div.p: Ravens WR Dez Bryant caught an 11-yard touchdown pass from Lamar Jackson in the second quarter Sunday, marking the first time he had reached the end zone since Dec. 10, 2017.

The Ravens dominated the Jaguars in the first half with J.K. Dobbins and a less-than-full strength defense. Dobbins ran for 51 yards and scored a touchdown in the first two quarters. Without two top cornerbacks and defensive end Calais Campbell, the Baltimore defense has shut out Jacksonville, holding the Jaguars to 61 yards while recording a safety. It was only three years ago when the Ravens trailed the Jaguars 23-0, at halftime in London. Now, the Ravens lead the Jaguars, 26-0, in Baltimore.

ul.data-name: The Ravens dominated the Jaguars in the first half with J.K. Dobbins and a less-than-full strength defense. Dobbins ran for 51 yards and scored a touchdown in the first two quarters. Without two top cornerbacks and defensive end Calais Campbell, the Baltimore defense has shut out Jacksonville, holding the Jaguars to 61 yards while recording a safety. It was only three years ago when the Ravens trailed the Jaguars 23-0, at halftime in London. Now, the Ravens lead the Jaguars, 26-0, in Baltimore.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

div.p: Ravens CB Marcus Peters is inactive for first time since 2017 season finale. This ends the second-longest current consecutive games streak for cornerbacks at 45. Peters, who is dealing with a calf injury, had been listed as questionable after not practicing all week. Baltimore is also without cornerback Jimmy Smith, who was ruled out with ribs and shoulder injuries.

ul.data-name: Ravens CB Marcus Peters is inactive for first time since 2017 season finale. This ends the second-longest current consecutive games streak for cornerbacks at 45. Peters, who is dealing with a calf injury, had been listed as questionable after not practicing all week. Baltimore is also without cornerback Jimmy Smith, who was ruled out with ribs and shoulder injuries.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

div.p: Ravens RB Mark Ingram is a healthy scratch for Sunday's game against the Jaguars. A Pro Bowl player last season, Ingram has been getting phased out of the game plan and had one snap on Monday night. The Ravens' running game is now J.K. Dobbins and Gus Edwards. Baltimore has the NFL's No. 1 rushing attack and has gained over 200 yards rushing in back-to-back games.

ul.data-name: Ravens RB Mark Ingram is a healthy scratch for Sunday's game against the Jaguars. A Pro Bowl player last season, Ingram has been getting phased out of the game plan and had one snap on Monday night. The Ravens' running game is now J.K. Dobbins and Gus Edwards. Baltimore has the NFL's No. 1 rushing attack and has gained over 200 yards rushing in back-to-back games.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

div.p: Ravens are playing the Jaguars without two of their top three cornerbacks. Marcus Peters (calf) and Jimmy Smith (ribs/shoulder) are both inactive. Baltimore has five active cornerbacks but three of them are dealing with injuries: Anthony Averett (ankle), Tramon Williams (thigh) and Davontae Harris (ankle). Marlon Humphrey and Pierre Desire are the only active Baltimore cornerbacks not listed on the injury report.

ul.data-name: Ravens are playing the Jaguars without two of their top three cornerbacks. Marcus Peters (calf) and Jimmy Smith (ribs/shoulder) are both inactive. Baltimore has five active cornerbacks but three of them are dealing with injuries: Anthony Averett (ankle), Tramon Williams (thigh) and Davontae Harris (ankle). Marlon Humphrey and Pierre Desire are the only active Baltimore cornerbacks not listed on the injury report.

div.p: Ravens inactives vs. the Jaguars: CB Marcus Peters (calf), DE Calais Campbell (calf), RB Mark Ingram, CB Jimmy Smith (ribs/shoulder), DE Jihad Ward, LB Kristian Welch (foot) and C Trystan Colin-Castillo.

h1.a: Ravens' runners and Yannick Ngakoue primed for big day vs. Jaguars

div.p: To bolster their playoff chances, the Ravens need to make quick work of a Jacksonville team that has lost 12 games in a row.

h1.a: Ravens activate Brown before game vs. Jaguars

div.p: After quarantining for five days after being identified as high-risk close contacts, Marquise Brown and two other receivers were activated Saturday by the Baltimore Ravens.

h1.a: Ravens' Peters fined $12.5K over spitting incident

div.p: Ravens cornerback Marcus Peters has been fined $12,500 by the league for unsportsmanlike conduct after appearing to spit at Jarvis Landry as the Browns wide receiver walked away in their game Monday night.

h1.a: Lag vs. Jags? Ravens are perfect against NFL's most imperfect teams

div.p: Ravens feel they must win out to make the playoffs, and it starts with not letting down against the 1-12 Jaguars.

h1.a: One Ravens CB ruled out, four listed questionable

div.p: The Ravens are heading into Sunday's game against the Jaguars with Marlon Humphrey as the only cornerback on the roster not on the injury report.

Cornerback is a position to watch for the Ravens. Jimmy Smith (ribs/shoulder) was ruled out, and Marcus Peters (calf) and Anthony Averett (ankle) are both listed as questionable. Peters didn't practice all week. Wide receivers coach David Culley will not coach in the game due to illness. He will be replaced by senior assistant Craig Ver Steeg.

ul.data-name: Cornerback is a position to watch for the Ravens. Jimmy Smith (ribs/shoulder) was ruled out, and Marcus Peters (calf) and Anthony Averett (ankle) are both listed as questionable. Peters didn't practice all week. Wide receivers coach David Culley will not coach in the game due to illness. He will be replaced by senior assistant Craig Ver Steeg.

h1.a: The Right Time: Michael Smith on Accommodations for James Harden & Tecmo Bowl Exploits

div.p: Bomani and Michael Smith discuss why the Lamar Jackson game from Monday night was a “legendary” performance (1:05), HBCU homecoming’s (10:01), and why James Harden is a symbol for when making accommodations for superstars goes wrong (19:22). Plus, the most important discussion of the year, Tecmo bowl as the “greatest” video game ever and fictional characters that balled-out in dynasty mode on Madden and NCAA Football (45:42).

h1.a: Ravens CB called 'coward,' says spit unintentional

div.p: Browns WR Jarvis Landry called ' Marcus Peters a "coward" after video surfaced of the Ravens cornerback apparently spitting when Landry's back was turned to him on Monday night. Peters has denied that it was intentional.
